when_to_say: Used when referring to the airport or air travel.
example: أنا في المطار الآن (ana fi al-matar al-aan) - I am at the airport now.

when_to_say: Used when talking about traveling or going somewhere.
example: كانت الرحلة ممتعة (kanat ar-rihla mumti‘a) - The trip was enjoyable.

when_to_say: Used when booking tickets, hotels, or appointments.
example: لدي حجز في الفندق (ladayya hajz fi al-funduq) - I have a hotel reservation.

when_to_say: Used when traveling internationally.
example: نسيت جواز السفر! (naseet jawaz as-safar!) - I forgot my passport!

when_to_say: Used when talking about tickets for travel or events.
example: اشتريت تذكرة سفر (ishtaraytu tathkirat safar) - I bought a travel ticket.

when_to_say: Used when talking about lodging or accommodation.
example: هذا فندق جميل (hadha funduq jameel) - This is a nice hotel.

when_to_say: Used when navigating or asking for directions.

when_to_say: Used when talking about travel for leisure.
example: أحب السياحة كثيراً (uhibb as-siyaha katheeran) - I really like tourism.

when_to_say: Used for someone who helps with directions or explanations.

when_to_say: Used when referring to crossing countries.

when_to_say: Used when traveling abroad and needing permission to enter a country.

when_to_say: General word for travel.
example: السفر مفيد للعقل (as-safar mufeed lil'aql) - Travel is good for the mind.

when_to_say: Used for the place you are heading to.

when_to_say: Used when talking about taxis.

when_to_say: Used for train, bus, or metro stations.

when_to_say: Used for rail travel.

when_to_say: Used when referring to travel bags.

when_to_say: Used when locating an exit in stations or airports.

when_to_say: Used when finding building entrances.

when_to_say: Used when traveling by sea between short distances.

when_to_say: Used when referring to food in general.

when_to_say: Used when asking for or referring to water.

when_to_say: Used when referring to meat.

when_to_say: Used when talking about fish.

when_to_say: Used when ordering or talking about coffee.

when_to_say: Used when seasoning food.

when_to_say: Used for food servings.

when_to_say: Used when expressing joy or pleasure.

when_to_say: Used to describe sadness or grief.

when_to_say: Used when expressing amazement.

when_to_say: Used when feeling blocked or unmotivated.

when_to_say: Used when feeling relaxed.

when_to_say: Used to describe stressful moments.

when_to_say: Used when referring to emotional or physical energy.

when_to_say: Used for affection or care.

when_to_say: Used when describing strong dislike.

when_to_say: Used when missing someone or something.
example: لدي اشتياق كبير لك (ladayya ishtiyaaq kabeer lak) - I miss you a lot.

when_to_say: Used when feeling calm and safe.
example: أشعر بالطمأنينة (ash‘ur bit-tuma'neena) - I feel peaceful.

when_to_say: Used when proud of an achievement.

when_to_say: Used when motivated by an idea.

when_to_say: Used when expressing deep interest.
example: لدي شغف بالتعلم (ladayya shaghaf bit-ta‘allum) - I have passion for learning.

when_to_say: Used when remembering the past with emotion.
example: أشعر بالحنين للماضي (ash‘ur bil-haneen lil-maadi) - I feel nostalgia for the past.

when_to_say: Used when embarrassed or shy.
example: أشعر بالخجل (ash‘ur bil-khajal) - I feel shy.

when_to_say: Used when looking forward to something.
example: لدينا أمل كبير (ladayna amal kabeer) - We have great hope.

when_to_say: Used to refer to God in Islam.
example: الحمد لله (al-hamdu lillah) - Praise be to God.

when_to_say: Used when referring to the holy book of Islam.
example: أقرأ القرآن كل يوم (aqra' al-Qur'an kull yawm) - I read the Quran every day.

when_to_say: Used when talking about performing prayer.
example: أؤدي الصلاة في المسجد (u'addi as-salaah fi al-masjid) - I perform prayer in the mosque.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a place of worship.
example: الذهاب إلى المسجد مهم (adh-dhahab ila al-masjid muhimm) - Going to the mosque is important.

when_to_say: Used when making personal prayers to God.
example: الدعاء يريح القلب (ad-du‘aa yureeH al-qalb) - Supplication comforts the heart.

when_to_say: Used when giving charity as required in Islam.
example: يجب دفع الزكاة (yajibu daf‘ az-zakaah) - One must pay Zakat.

when_to_say: Used during Ramadan or voluntary fasting.

when_to_say: Used when performing pilgrimage to Mecca.

when_to_say: Used to describe faith in God.
example: الإيمان بالله قوي (al-imaan bi-Allah qawi) - Faith in God is strong.

when_to_say: Used to refer to prophets in Islam.
example: محمد رسول الله (Muhammad rasool Allah) - Muhammad is the messenger of God.

when_to_say: Used when speaking about heaven in Islam.

when_to_say: Used when referring to punishment or hell.

when_to_say: Used in daily recitations and worship.

when_to_say: Used when speaking about the oneness of God.

when_to_say: Used when declaring the Islamic faith.

when_to_say: Used during Ramadan or voluntary fasting.

when_to_say: Used when praying at night.

when_to_say: Used when referring to ritual cleanliness.

when_to_say: Used when talking about the religion of Islam.

when_to_say: Used to describe belief in God.
example: الإيمان يقوي الروح (al-imaan yuqawwi ar-rooh) - Faith strengthens the soul.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a school building or institution.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a female teacher.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a female student.

when_to_say: Used when referring to school subjects.

when_to_say: Used when referring to school homework.

when_to_say: Used when referring to school or university exams.

when_to_say: Used when referring to reading activities.

when_to_say: Used when referring to writing activities.

when_to_say: Used when referring to writing tools.
